newsitem.title: USA: BASEBALL-ANGELS SIGN INFIELDER DAVE HOLLINS.
newsitem.headline: BASEBALL-ANGELS SIGN INFIELDER DAVE HOLLINS.

text.p: The Anaheim Angels added some power to their infield Wednesday with the signing of free agent Dave Hollins, formerly of the Seattle Mariners.

The 31-year-old Hollins is primarily a third baseman but has also played first and the outfield in his seven-year major league career. Hollins hit .262 with 16 homers and 78 runs batted in with the Minnesota Twins and the Mariners last season.
Anaheim will be the fifth team in two years for the injury-plagued Hollins. He played 149 games last season after totalling only 144 games in the two previous seasons.
A lifetime .259 hitter, Hollins began his big-league career with Philadelphia in 1990. He had his best years with the Phillies. In 1992 he hit .270 with 27 home runs, 93 RBI and 104 runs scored.
Anaheim tried six different players at third base last season.
